articles.author: Ali Sawafta, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed 14 Palestinians during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Saturday, while an ambulance driver was killed as he went to pick up wounded from a separate attack by violent Jewish settlers, Palestinian authorities said.
articles.title: More than 14 Palestinians killed as violence flares in West Bank

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: The Israeli settlers who rampaged through the West Bank village of al-Mughayyer on April 12 came in greater numbers and carried more weapons than during any of the previous raids on the Palestinian community, residents said.
articles.title: West Bank village counts losses after settler attack, and fears more

articles.author: Borja Suarez
articles.description: Thousands of people protested in Tenerife on Saturday, calling for the Spanish island to temporarily limit tourist arrivals to stem a boom in short-term holiday rentals and hotel construction that is driving up housing costs for locals.
articles.title: Thousands protest in Spain's Canary Islands over mass tourism

articles.author: Richard Cowan, Moira Warburton, Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The unusual four-bill package also includes funds for Israel, security assistance for Taiwan and allies in the Indo-Pacific, and a measure that includes sanctions, a threat to ban the Chinese-owned social media app TikTok, and the potential transfer of seized Russian assets to Ukraine.
articles.title: US House passes $95 billion Ukraine, Israel aid package, sends to Senate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Saturday that U.S. House of Representatives' approval of security aid to Ukraine would lead to more damage and deaths in the conflict there.
articles.title: Aid bill's passage will hurt Ukraine, cause more deaths, Kremlin says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Sunday that U.S. lawmakers' approval of $60.84 billion more in support for Ukraine showed that Washington was wading deeper into a hybrid war with Russia that would end in a humiliation on a par with Vietnam or Afghanistan.
articles.title: Russia says deeper U.S. hybrid war using Ukraine will end in Vietnam-style humiliation

articles.author: Rami Amichay
articles.description: Thousands of Israeli demonstrators took to the streets on Saturday to call for new elections and demand more action from the government to bring the hostages held in Gaza home, in the latest round of protests against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
articles.title: Thousands of Israelis join anti-government protests

articles.author: Jasper Ward, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Iran's foreign minister on Friday said Tehran was investigating an overnight attack on Iran, adding that so far a link to Israel had not been proven as he downplayed the strike.
articles.title: Iran's foreign minister downplays drone attack, says Tehran investigating

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least two people are dead and six others injured in a shooting at a block party in Memphis, Tennessee, on Saturday, according to police.
articles.title: Two dead, six injured in Memphis block party shooting, police says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea on Sunday protested Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's offering to Tokyo's Yasukuni Shrine with "deep disappointment" and urged Japanese leaders to show repentance for the country's wartime past.
articles.title: South Korea protests Japanese leaders' offerings to Yasukuni shrine
